title: 112_hr2867
content: The Act is titled the "United States Commission on International Religious Freedom Reform and Reauthorization Act of 2011." It establishes that each member of the Commission shall serve a 2-year term and not more than 2 terms. The United States Commission on International Religious Freedom Reform and Reauthorization Act of 2011 states that members can serve a maximum of 2 terms on the Commission. If a member has completed 2 full terms, their term will expire 90 days after such date. Additionally, a member cannot serve after the expiration of their term. The United States Commission on International Religious Freedom Reform and Reauthorization Act of 2011 limits members to serving 2 terms on the Commission. If a member attends less than 75% of meetings during a term, they are ineligible for reappointment. Additionally, no member can be elected as Chair for a second consecutive term. The United States Commission on International Religious Freedom Reform and Reauthorization Act of 2011 limits members to serving 2 terms on the Commission. Members are subject to Federal Travel Regulation and Department of State Standardized Regulations. No member can be elected as Chair for a second consecutive term. SEC. 3. APPLICATION OF ANTIDISCRIMINATION LAWS. Amends the International Religious Freedom Act to include application of antidiscrimination laws for addressing violations. The new subsection (g) applies antidiscrimination laws to address violations related to employment discrimination, family and medical leave, fair labor standards, employee protections, veterans' employment, Americans with Disabilities Act, occupational safety, labor-management relations, and rights of employees paid by the Senate or House. Employees of the Commission will be treated as Senate or House employees for pay purposes. Any pending claims can be maintained under the International Religious Freedom Act. Authorization of appropriations is also included. Under section 204(g) of the International Religious Freedom Act of 1998, appropriations are authorized for fiscal years 2012 through 2014. Standards of conduct and disclosure are amended, increasing the amount to $250,000 and changing the reference from "International Relations" to "Foreign Affairs." Termination is also addressed. SEC. 6 amends the termination date to September 30, 2014. SEC. 7 requires a report on the effectiveness of programs promoting religious freedom within a year of the Act's enactment. The Comptroller General will submit a report to congressional committees on the implementation of the Act and its amendments. The report will review the effectiveness of US Government programs promoting international religious freedom and assess the Office on International Religious Freedom. The report will assess the roles and functions of the Office on International Religious Freedom and the Ambassador at Large for International Religious Freedom within the Department of State. The report will review the goals and structure of the United States Commission on International Religious Freedom, comparing it to other advisory commissions. The curr_chunk discusses a review of the relationship between the Ambassador at Large for International Religious Freedom and the United States Commission on International Religious Freedom, aiming to improve their ability to achieve their goals. The term "appropriate congressional committees" is defined in this section. The curr_chunk discusses the roles of the Speaker of the House of Representatives and the Vice President of the United States as President of the Senate.
